title: Sols 4454-4457: Getting Ready to Fill the Long Weekend with Science
summary: Earth planning date: Friday, Feb. 14, 2025 Curiosity is continuing to make progress along the strategic route, traversing laterally across the sulfate (salt) bearing unit toward the boxwork structures. title: Orbex Betting the Farm on Its European Launcher Challenge Bid
summary:
UK-based rocket builder Orbex has revealed that it is counting on a positive outcome from its European Launch Challenge bid to fund the development of its medium-lift rocket, Proxima, citing a “challenging investment climate.” The European Space Agency initiated the European Launcher Challenge in November 2023 to support the development of sovereign launch capabilities and, […]

title: ESA astronaut with physical disability medically cleared for ISS missions
summary:
In a first, a European astronaut with a physical disability has been medically cleared for missions to the International Space Station.

title: Firefly’s Blue Ghost lander arrives in lunar orbit
summary: The robotic lander reached the Moon’s orbit after performing its 4 minute and 15 second Lunar Orbit Insertion burn, which began at 8:51 p.m. EST on Feb. 13 (0151 UTC on Feb. 14).

title: Blue Ghost 1 enters lunar orbit as Resilience flies by the moon
summary:
One commercial lunar lander has entered orbit around the moon while another, launched at the same time, made a lunar flyby to set up a later return.
